result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 11:29 AM Defendant Paul S. Schraven in court, in custody.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Paul S. Schraven.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Repeater enhancer dismissed. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 & 3 - DRI. The parties waive the PSI but are requesting an adjourned sentencing date. The parties will submit a written memorandum regarding their sentencing recommendations prior to the hearing.
